mainmenu

Class MainMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • mainmenu.MainMenu

  • public class MainMenu
extends javafx.application.Application
    This class represents the pong game done in javafx. This class calls all the sub-methods and initializes the game start. The game has two levels- normal and hard, adding moving paddles to make the game more challenging. Two users can control the player paddles using A and D and Up and Down keys respectively. The game ends after one user scores 7 points.
    Author:
    Maksym Kolov, Neil Patel, Austin Mclemore

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        This start method launches the pong game. Initially, the main menu is displayed showing the button to start the game or exit, then the next pane stores the game difficulty choice. After the choice is made, that actual game starts.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - Defines that stage for the game to launch.

      • backToMenu

        public void backToMenu()
        This method calls the main menu again when the game is done and a user would like to go back and change the difficulty level or exit the game. * *

      • move

        public void move()
        This method controls the logic behind the movements of the circles in the main menu.

      • exit

        public void exit()
        This method exits the the game and closes the window when the exit button is clicked.

      • diffPick

        public void diffPick()
        This method calls the difficulty level pane if a user selects to start a new game in the main menu.

      • begin

        public void begin()
        This method calls the Pong class to start the game. It also stops the main menu animation and hides it from view.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method to launch the project.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments
